summary: This is a discovery and Brady material request letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The letter outlines 22 specific requests for evidence, documents, and information related to Maxwell's criminal case, including materials about the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement, victim identities, witness communications, and exculpatory evidence.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of the law firm writing the letter; the subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which discovery is being requested.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Repeatedly referenced in relation to the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA), alleged abuse, and communications with victims and attorneys.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP who signed the letter on behalf of client Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Named as one of the "Attorneys" representing victims, referenced in relation to meetings with SDNY prosecutors in 2016.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Named as one of the "Attorneys" representing victims in communications with the government.

connections.description: Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated Epstein's sexual abuse of minors; the defense requests communications and evidence concerning both.
Everdell is writing this discovery request letter on behalf of his client, Ghislaine Maxwell.
Edwards is an attorney for Epstein's victims, referenced in the context of meetings with prosecutors about investigating Epstein.
Edwards is an attorney for victims, and the defense requests communications between him and prosecutors concerning Maxwell.

events.title: Signing of Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed a Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with the government, which the defense seeks all communications about.

events.title: Victim Attorneys Meet with SDNY Prosecutors
events.description: Attorneys for victims, including Bradley Edwards, met with SDNY prosecutors to request a criminal investigation into Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: SDNY Investigation Begins
events.description: The government asserts it began the SDNY investigation into Epstein and Maxwell around this time.

events.title: Deadline for Government Response
events.description: The defense requests a response from the government by this date regarding the discovery requests, or they will file necessary motions.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida
keyFacts: The defense is requesting the identities and complete birthdays of the individuals identified in the indictment as Minor Victims 1-3.
The defense seeks all communications concerning the negotiation of Jeffrey Epstein's September 24, 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA), including unredacted emails.
The letter references a 2016 meeting where victim attorneys, including Bradley Edwards, met with SDNY prosecutors to ask for a criminal investigation into Epstein and Maxwell.
The defense requests the complete FBI case file regarding an investigation of an unnamed individual for obstruction of justice, referenced in a prior government production.
The defense makes extensive Brady requests, including for exculpatory evidence, impeachment material, and information about witness incentives and credibility.
